humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, the left axillary sentinel lymph node (specimen A) is positive for carcinoma, while the right axillary sentinel lymph nodes (specimens C and D) and the additional 4 lymph nodes from the left axillary contents (specimen F) are negative for malignancy. Therefore, the patient has metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes, which corresponds to the N1 stage based on the AJCC staging system.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for a cancer patient is determined by the presence and extent of cancer in the lymph nodes. According to the pathology report, there is metastatic carcinoma present in one lymph node from the left axilla (specimen A). Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N1. This is based on the pTNM staging system, where N1 indicates metastasis in 1-3 axillary lymph nodes.
